info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 22 at 3:03AM MDT until April 23 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches over the Little Belt mountains and portions of Judith Basin and Fergus counties south of U.S. 87 with up to 10 inches over Kings Hill. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Cascade, Fergus, Judith Basin and Meagher Counties. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 6 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Accumulating snowfall is primarily expected to affect areas at elevations above 4500 feet, including Kings Hill and Lewistown Divide.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
